Korean People's Anti-U.S. Struggle Supported in India
articles.content:
Korean People's Anti-U.S. Struggle Supported in India 
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of India will boost its relations with the Workers' Party of Korea and positively support the struggle of the Party and the people of the DPRK against the United States.
 A. B. Bardhan said this when meeting with DPRK Ambassador to the country Han Chang On who paid a congratulatory call on him on April 9 on the occasion of his reelection as general secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India.
 Voices condemning the U.S. imperialists' moves against the DPRK rang out loudly from the recent 19th congress of the CPI, the general secretary noted.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Clearly Understand Reality before Disarmament Talks
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Clearly Understand Reality before Disarmament Talks 
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration reportedly released a statement titled "The United States should clearly understand the reality before coming out for disarmament talks" on April 11, which stressed that the press statement issued by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry on March 31 is an appropriate proposal reflecting the changed reality of the Korean Peninsula.
 Referring to the detailed facts that the U.S. has posed a serious nuclear threat on the peninsula in violation of the Armistice Agreement, the statement noted that the denuclearization of the peninsula cannot be promoted by the north's unilateral abandonment of its nukes.    
 It is the only way for the peace, stability and denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula to pull all nuclear weapons and the U.S. troops out of this land, it stated, urging the U.S. to give up its arrogant attitude and come out for the disarmament talks at once.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Djibouti
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Djibouti 
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Ismail Omar Guelleh on his reelection as president of Djibouti.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president and people of Djibouti greater successes in their work for the building of a new society.

Greetings to Zimbabwean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Zimbabwean President
    Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Robert G. Mugabe, president of the Republic of Zimbabwe, on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of the foundation of the republic.
 The message said that the Korean people are sincerely rejoiced over the great achievements made by the government and people of Zimbabwe for 25 years in their struggle to defend the sovereignty of the country and achieve national unity and economic prosperity despite all sorts of challenges.    
 Reaffirming the stand to boost the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, the message wished the president good health and success in his responsible work.

articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Heads of Foreign Delegations
     Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday met and had friendly talks with heads of delegations of Juche Idea study organizations from different countries including Vishwanath, director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, on a visit to the DPRK at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
  On hand were officials concerned including Rim Hoe Song, vice-chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Society.

Order and Medals Awarded to Adherents to Juche Idea
articles.content:
Order and Medals Awarded to Adherents to Juche Idea
    Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of awarding an order and medals of the DPRK to adherents to the Juche idea on a visit to the DPRK was held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Rim Hoe Song, vice-chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Society, officials concerned, Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and members of delegations of the Juche Idea study organizations from different countries.    
 After a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly was conveyed Friendship Order Second Class was awarded to Stanislav Dobek, head of a Polish delegation for the study of the Juche idea, and Friendship Medals to six adherents to the Juche idea for supporting the Korean people in their struggle to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation of Juche and national reunification and working hard to study and disseminate the greatness of the Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea and the immortal Juche idea in humble reverence for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Greetings to Syrian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Syrian President
    Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria, on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of its independence.
 Noting that the Korean people know well that after the independence, the Syrian Arab people have achieved great successes in the work to defend the sovereignty of the country and dignity of the nation and build a developed and modern society and highly appreciate them, the message said that the Korean people always extend support and solidarity to the Syrian Arab people in their just cause to defeat the ceaseless pressure and threat of outside forces, ensure peace and security in the region and fairly and comprehensively settle the Mideast issue.    
 The message sincerely wished the friendly Syrian Arab people greater progress and prosperity and expressed expectation and conviction that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the future, too.

Congratulations to Queen of Denmark
articles.content:
Congratulations to Queen of Denmark
    Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Queen Margrethe the Second on her birthday, the national holiday of Denmark.
 The message wished her good health and happiness and Danish people welfare and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Syrian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Syrian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Muhammad Nazi Otri, prime minister of Syria, on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of its independence.
 The message sincerely wished him and the Syrian government greater success in the work to build a modern and developed Syria.    
 Meanwhile, DPRK Minister of Foreign Affairs Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his Syrian counterpart Farouk Al-Shara on the same occasion.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received gifts from Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, a delegation of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand led by its Chairman Songchit Pullarp and a Japanese delegation for commemorating the Day of the Sun headed by Hiroyuki Kasai, member of the Saitama Prefectural People's Council for Japan-Korea Friendship and Solidarity, on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 Gifts were handed over to an official concerned.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Greetings to Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Greetings to Syrian President
    Pyongyang, April 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Bashar Al-Assad, general secretary of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party and president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of its independence.
 Noting that since its independence the Syrian Arab people under the leadership of the Baath Arab Socialist Party have achieved great successes in the work to develop and modernize the country for 59 years, the message said that the Korean people will fully support the Syrian Arab people in their just cause to defend the country's sovereignty and security and comprehensively and fairly settle the Mideast issue despite all kinds of
pressure and threat of outside forces in the future, too.    
 Expressing the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, it sincerely wished the Syrian government and people greater progress and prosperity.
